name: OrderHandlingIncident
comment: This entity represents an incident that self healing has received from any order handling microservice/component. Self healing will further decide to either send back an action to consumer e.g. retry or to send this incident to fallout domain for further handling.
vf short description: This entity represents an incident that self healing has received from any order handling microservice/component. Self healing will further decide to either send back an action to consumer e.g.

fields.name: OrderHandlingIncidentSK
fields.comment: Surrogate key of the object

fields.name: ValidFromDate
fields.comment: BI field which represents record validity begin in EDWH

fields.name: ValidUntilDate
fields.comment: BI field which represents record validity begin in EDWH

fields.name: KeyTypeId
fields.comment: Key type of record

fields.name: OrderHandlingIncidentKey
fields.comment: Uniquely identifies an incident tracking event. This represents an incident that self healing has received from any order handling microservice/component. Self healing will further decide to either send back an action to consumer e.g. retry or to send this incident to fallout domain for further handling. Generated Key based on Incident Tracking Event Id

fields.name: IncidentEventId
fields.comment: Identifier of the event OHIncidentTrackingNotification.eventId

fields.name: IncidentEventDate
fields.comment: Creation date of the event OHIncidentTrackingNotification.eventTime

fields.name: IncidentEventTypeInd
fields.comment: Name of the notification resource OHIncidentTrackingNotification.eventType

fields.name: ResourceVersionInd
fields.comment: Version of the associated resource entity OHIncidentTrackingNotification.incidentTrackingEvent.resourceVersion

fields.name: OrderHandlingFlowSK
fields.comment: Surrogate key of the object

fields.name: OrderHandlingFlowStepSK
fields.comment: Surrogate key of the object

fields.name: FlowId
fields.comment: Unique ID of the flow allocated to an order item in the order. An order can have multiple flows hence there can be multiple flow context IDs. In case a flow is not external and is running in Order Handling system, there is a flow context ID. OHIncidentTrackingNotification.incidentTrackingEvent.relatedFlow.id

fields.name: StepInstanceId
fields.comment: The instance ID of the step that is executed. This comes from the BPM engine. OHIncidentTrackingNotification.incidentTrackingEvent.relatedStep.instanceId

fields.name: FlowRunId
fields.comment: ID of the flow instance run. In case of a BPMN engine, this is the process instance ID returned by the engine. In case of Lite Orchestration, this is generated internally by the Order Handling framework. OHIncidentTrackingNotification.incidentTrackingEvent.relatedFlow.flowRunId

fields.name: FalloutEventId
fields.comment: The Id of the fallout event. OHIncidentTrackingNotification.incidentTrackingEvent.relatedFalloutEvent.id

fields.name: FalloutEventExternalId
fields.comment: The external Id generated by order handling for the fallout incident/event. OHIncidentTrackingNotification.incidentTrackingEvent.relatedFalloutEvent.externalId

fields.name: OrderSK
fields.comment: Surrogate key of the object

fields.name: IncidentErrorCode
fields.comment: Error code related to the failure. OHIncidentTrackingNotification.incidentTrackingEvent.errorInfo.errorCode

fields.name: IncidentErrorMessage
fields.comment: Error message related to the failure. OHIncidentTrackingNotification.incidentTrackingEvent.errorInfo.errorMessage

fields.name: IncidentErrorStackTraceDetail
fields.comment: Stack trace related to the failure. OHIncidentTrackingNotification.incidentTrackingEvent.errorInfo.stackTrace

fields.name: AlreadyReportedFlag
fields.comment: This tells that caller has already reported this issue / error earlier and is reporting again. OHIncidentTrackingNotification.incidentTrackingEvent.alreadyReported

fields.name: SendToFalloutFlag
fields.comment: This tells that caller has asked self healing to directly send the incindent to fallout (skip rule engine). OHIncidentTrackingNotification.incidentTrackingEvent.sendToFallout

fields.name: TraceId
fields.comment: This will be trace id as received from the consumers, to be used for tracking and troubleshooting. OHIncidentTrackingNotification.incidentTrackingEvent.traceId

fields.name: SourceSystemId
fields.comment: Represents the code of the source system that the leading entity of the current target is coming from. It is suffix also include the code of the DB instance on that system such that in case of multiple instances of the same source system are deployed (Scalability) it will be possible to trace the target to it is source system instance

fields.name: DeleteIndicator
fields.comment: Set to True when the leading source entity of this target entity was deleted in the source system

fields.name: RowUpdateTime
fields.comment: The time stamp when the row was written to the Target real-time/staging storage

fields.name: SourceUpdateTime
fields.comment: The latest create/update timestamp of any of the entities composing this target entity

fields.name: SourceQueryTime
fields.comment: The timestamp of reading the data from source system. - when using CDC it is usually similar to the latest update, in SQL cases it is the time of running the SQL. When a dummy target entity is created as a temporary entity to maintain referential integrity this indicator will be set to True. As soon as the real target entity is stored it will be stored with False dummy indicator value.

fields.name: DptiId
fields.comment: Counter which represents the cycle number of the job	is_deleted	boolean	is_deleted	Represents if the record is deleted. Is been updated after the compaction job

fields.name: PTime
fields.comment: Partition time based on the event time for target entities marked to be partitioned event time rounded the correct partition window (hourly, daily etc..)

fields.name: Insert_Load_Id
fields.comment: BI technical field for job id which inserted the record in the table

fields.name: Update_Load_Id
fields.comment: BI technical field for job id which updated the record in the table
